content:
#### 9. Exclusion of Rights Under the Contracts (Rights of Third Parties) Act
A person who is not a party to this Policy contract shall have no right under the Contracts (Rights of Third Parties) Act (Cap 53B) to enforce any of its terms.
questions: What does the Contracts (Rights of Third Parties) Act (Cap 53B) entail?
Can someone who is not a party to the policy enforce any terms of the policy?
What is the purpose of the exclusion of rights under the Contracts (Rights of Third Parties) Act in the policy?
Does the policy allow third parties to have rights under it?
What legal act is referenced in the policy regarding third-party rights?
How does the policy contract address the rights of individuals not party to it?
What implications does the exclusion of third-party rights have on the policy?
Is there any provision for third parties to claim rights under this policy?
What does 'Exclusion of Rights Under the Contracts (Rights of Third Parties) Act' mean in the context of the policy?
Which chapter of the Contracts (Rights of Third Parties) Act is mentioned in the policy exclusion?
